# Unit 1

Welcome to Unit 1! This unit covers the High Renaissance style of the sixteenth century. We'll work on species counterpoint, while studying the music of composers such as Josquin, Lasso, Palestrina, Byrd, and Monteverdi.

# Assignments

  • Homework 1 (due 8/27)
  • Homework 2 (due 8/31 -- will accept on 9/4 without penalty)
  • Homework 3 (due 9/7)
  • Homework 4 (due 9/14)
  • Project 1 (due 9/17)

# Additional Scores

  • Josquin, Missa de Beata Vergine (clean copy)
  • Palestrina, Missa benedicta es (excerpts)
  • Monteverdi, Cruda Amarilli

# Listening List

  • Josquin, Missa Pange Lingua, Kyrie (translation)
    • Kyrie I, Christe
  • Josquin, Missa de Beata Vergine, Kyrie (translation)
    • Kyrie I, Christe, Kyrie II
  • Josquin, “Benedicta es, caelorum regina” (motet, translation)
    • "Benedicta es, caelorum regina", "Per illud ave"
  • Josquin, Missa Hercules Dux Ferrarie, Sanctus & Benedictus (translation)
    • Sanctus, Pleni sunt coeli,
  • Josquin, “En l’ombre d’ung boissonet” (chanson, translation)
    • "En l'ombre"
  • Palestrina, Missa Brevis, Kyrie (translation)
    • Kyrie I, Christe
  • Palestrina, Missa Ut re mi fa sol la, Sanctus (translation)
    • Sanctus
  • Palestrina, “Surge, amica mea” (motet, translation)
    • "Surge, amica mea"
  • Palestrina, Missa Benedicta es (score, translation)
    • "Et in terra pax", "Pleni sunt coeli, Hosanna
  • Lasso, “La nuict froide et sombre” (chanson, translation)
    • "La nuict"
  • Lasso, “Expectatio justorum” (motet, translation)
    • "Expectatio justorum"
  • Victoria, “O magnum mysterium” (motet, translation)
    • "O magnum mysterium"
  • Byrd, Mass for four voices, Kyrie (translation)
    • Kyrie I, Christe, Kyrie II
  • Byrd, “Civitas sancti tui” (motet, translation)
    • "Civitas sancti tui"
  • Monteverdi, Messa da capella for four voices, Kyrie (translation)
    • Kyrie I
  • Monteverdi, Il lamento d’Arianna, “Lasciatemi morire” (madrigal, translation)
    • "Lasciatemi morire"
  • Monteverdi, “Cruda amarilli” (madrigal, score, translation)
    • "Cruda amarilli"
  • Monteverdi, “Ch’io t’ami” (madrigal, translation)
    • "Ch'io t'ami"

Youtube Playlist

# Terminology and Concepts

# Genres

  • Mass (+ Kyrie, Gloria, Sanctus & Benedictus, Agnus Dei)
  • Motet
  • Chanson
  • Madrigal

# Techniques and other Terminology

  • Counterpoint
    • Consonance, Dissonance
    • Parallel, Contrary, Oblique, and Similar motion
    • Suspensions, Neighbor and Passing tones
  • Species counterpoint (+ First, Second, Fourth species)
  • Cadences
    • Evaded cadences
    • Cantus (8-7-8) and Tenor (2-1) formulas
    • "Fake" suspensions
  • Imitation, Point of Imitation, Paired imitation
  • Subject
    • Countersubject
    • "Soggetto Cavato" (9/7)
    • Transformations of the subject: Inversion, Retrograde, Diminution, Augmentation (9/12)
  • Pre-existing material
    • Plainchant
    • Techniques for using: Cantus firmus, Paraphrase, Parody
  • Modes
    • Dorian, Phrygian, Lydian, Mixolydian, Aeolian, Ionian
    • Hypodorian, Hypophrygian, etc.
    • Authentic and Plagal
    • Range, Ambitus
    • "Transposed" modes (G dorian, for example)
  • Hexachord
    • Natural, Hard, and Soft Hexachords
    • Mutation (9/5)
    • Gamut
    • Solfège, Solmization (Ut, re, mi, fa, sol, la)
    • Gamma ut, A la mi re, etc.
  • Text setting, Word Painting (9/12)
  • Prima Pratica vs. Seconda Pratica (9/14)
